thread.title: Coffee shop trading brewery spot for the Brewery District
thread.title_full: Coffee shop trading brewery spot for the Brewery District

author: Dan Eaton
title: Coffee shop trading brewery spot for the Brewery District
text: Das KaffeeHaus’ Joe Contino and Amy Contino. Dan Eaton A coffeehouse that prides itself on being loud is landing a place that can easily accommodate that. Das KaffeeHaus von Frau Burkhart is opening in the Big Room Bar at CD102.5’s studios at 1036 Front St. Das KaffeeHaus’ Joe Contino and Amy Contino. Dan Eaton The Lithopolis-based coffee shop is moving to the radio station’s Brewery District bar from a space inside Zauber Brewing Co. near Grandview Heights. Joe Contino previously told me his European-inspired shop eschews the low-key, mellow vibe many associate with coffee shops in favor of a more pub-like atmosphere and thumping electronic music soundtrack. Contino and his wife Amy Contino started the business in Lithopolis, where they reside. The couple met in the military and have traveled throughout Europe, still making one or two visits to Germany a year. Their inspiration comes from shops in the northwest part of that country and the house blend is a recipe from Contino’s favorite, a shop called Plum’s Kaffee in Aachen, Germany. In addition to its signature roasts, the shop also will serve pastries including cinnamon rolls, cream puffs, cake-balls and turnovers. The shop will open March 27 and will operate daily from 7 a.m. to 4 p.m., at which point the Big Room Bar opens. Dan Eaton covers retailing and restaurants for Columbus Business First.
